intro: Convolvulus dorycnium subsp. oxysepalus, commonly known as the narrowleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The flowers are typically pale blue or violet, with five petals and a distinctive, elongated calyx. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. This subspecies is notable for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
